api_endpoints.name: get-/events/v3/events/_getPage

description.tagline: Retrieve instances of event completion data for contacts.
description.detailed: Use this tool to obtain all event completions associated with a specific contact. Ideal for tracking event interactions or analyzing contact engagement.

arguments.name: crm_object_type
arguments.description: The CRM object type to filter event instances (e.g., 'contact'). Specify when retrieving data for a CRM record. Include 'object_id' if needed.

arguments.name: event_type_name
arguments.description: Specify the name of the event type to filter event completion instances.

arguments.name: paging_cursor_after_token
arguments.description: The paging cursor token from the last read resource for paginated results.

arguments.name: paging_before_cursor
arguments.description: The cursor token for paginating backwards. Use this if you want to navigate to results displayed before the current page.

arguments.name: maximum_results_per_page
arguments.description: The maximum number of results to display per page. Set this to control pagination.

arguments.name: sort_by_timestamp_direction
arguments.description: Specifies the sort direction based on the event instance timestamp. Acceptable values are `ASCENDING` or `DESCENDING`.

arguments.name: filter_after_datetime
arguments.description: Filter for event data that occurred after a specific datetime. Use ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2023-01-01T00:00:00Z').

arguments.name: filter_before_datetime
arguments.description: Filter to retrieve event data that occurred before a specified datetime. Provide in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2023-10-05T14:48:00Z').

arguments.name: crm_object_id
arguments.description: The ID of the CRM Object to filter event instances. Must be used with 'object_type'.

arguments.name: unique_identifier_property
arguments.description: Specify a unique identifier to retrieve event data for a CRM object. For contacts, use the `email` property, e.g., `unique_identifier_property.email=name@domain.com`.

arguments.name: event_property_filter
arguments.description: Specify a filter for event completions by an event property and its value (e.g., `hs_city=new+york`). Replace spaces with `%20` or `+`.

arguments.name: event_instance_ids
arguments.description: IDs of event instances to filter. Use an array to specify multiple IDs. Other filters must match the event values for results.

api_endpoints.description: Retrieve instances of event completion data. For example, retrieve all event completions associated with a specific contact.

query.name: objectType

value_schema.description: The type of CRM object to filter event instances on (e.g., `contact`). To retrieve event data for a specific CRM record, include the additional `objectId` query parameter (below).

query.description: The type of CRM object to filter event instances on (e.g., `contact`). To retrieve event data for a specific CRM record, include the additional `objectId` query parameter (below).

query.name: eventType

value_schema.description: The event type name. You can retrieve available event types using the [event types endpoint](#get-%2Fevents%2Fv3%2Fevents%2Fevent-types).

query.description: The event type name. You can retrieve available event types using the [event types endpoint](#get-%2Fevents%2Fv3%2Fevents%2Fevent-types).

query.name: after

value_schema.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

query.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

query.name: limit

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

query.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

query.name: sort

value_schema.description: Sort direction based on the timestamp of the event instance, `ASCENDING` or `DESCENDING`.

query.description: Sort direction based on the timestamp of the event instance, `ASCENDING` or `DESCENDING`.

query.name: occurredAfter

value_schema.description: Filter for event data that occurred after a specific datetime.

query.description: Filter for event data that occurred after a specific datetime.

query.name: occurredBefore

value_schema.description: Filter for event data that occurred before a specific datetime.

query.description: Filter for event data that occurred before a specific datetime.

query.name: objectId

value_schema.description: The ID of the CRM Object to filter event instances on. When including this parameter, you must also include the `objectType` parameter.

query.description: The ID of the CRM Object to filter event instances on. When including this parameter, you must also include the `objectType` parameter.

query.name: objectProperty.{propname}

value_schema.description: Instead of retrieving event data for a specific object by its ID, you can specify a unique identifier property. For contacts, you can use the `email` property. (e.g., `objectProperty.email=name@domain.com`).

query.description: Instead of retrieving event data for a specific object by its ID, you can specify a unique identifier property. For contacts, you can use the `email` property. (e.g., `objectProperty.email=name@domain.com`).

query.name: property.{propname}

value_schema.description: Filter for event completions that contain a specific value for an event property (e.g., `property.hs_city=portland`). For properties values with spaces, replaces spaces with `%20` or `+` (e.g., `property.hs_city=new+york`).

query.description: Filter for event completions that contain a specific value for an event property (e.g., `property.hs_city=portland`). For properties values with spaces, replaces spaces with `%20` or `+` (e.g., `property.hs_city=new+york`).

query.name: id

value_schema.description: ID of an event instance. IDs are 1:1 with event instances. If you provide this filter and additional filters, the other filters must match the values on the event instance to yield results.

query.description: ID of an event instance. IDs are 1:1 with event instances. If you provide this filter and additional filters, the other filters must match the values on the event instance to yield results.

api_endpoints.name: get-/events/v3/events/event-types_getTypes

wrapper_tool.name: list_event_types

description.tagline: Retrieve a list of visible event type names.
description.detailed: This tool retrieves a list of event type names that are visible to the user, which can be used to query specific event instances.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: A list of event type names visible to the user.

api_endpoints.description:
This endpoint returns a list of event type names which are visible to you. You may use these event type names to query the API for specific event instances of a desired type.

Note: the `get_types` method is only supported in the Python SDK version `12.0.0-beta.1` or later.

description.tagline: Retrieve existing custom event definitions from Hubspot.
description.detailed: Use this tool to obtain the current list of custom event definitions stored in Hubspot. It helps in understanding or displaying existing events configured within your system.

arguments.name: event_name_search_string
arguments.description: String of characters to search for in event names. This is a simple 'contains' search without fuzzy matching.

arguments.name: paging_cursor_token
arguments.description: The token indicating the position after the last successfully read resource for continued paged results.

arguments.name: results_per_page_limit
arguments.description: The maximum number of event definitions to retrieve per page.

arguments.name: sort_order
arguments.description: Specify the order to sort results. Use 'ASC' for ascending or 'DESC' for descending.

arguments.name: include_event_properties
arguments.description: Include event properties in the response. Set to true to include all properties.

query.name: searchString

value_schema.description: Characters in the event name that the user is searching for. This search is a naive “contains” search, no fuzzy matching is done.

query.description: Characters in the event name that the user is searching for. This search is a naive “contains” search, no fuzzy matching is done.

query.name: after

value_schema.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

query.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

query.name: limit

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

query.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

api_endpoints.name: post-/events/v3/event-definitions

description.tagline: Create a custom event definition in HubSpot.
description.detailed: Use this tool to create a custom event definition within the HubSpot Events service when you need to track or define new events.

arguments.name: custom_event_definition
arguments.description: JSON object containing details of the custom event, including properties like name, label, description, primary object, and property definitions.

name.description: Internal property name, which must be used when referencing the property from the API

options.description: A list of available options for the property if it is an enumeration. NOTE: This field is only applicable for enumerated properties.

description.description: A description of the property that will be shown as help text in HubSpot.

label.description: Human readable label for the property. Used in HubSpot UI

type.description: The data type of the property. Can be one of the following: [string, number, enumeration, datetime]

propertyDefinitions.description: List of custom properties on event

name.description: Internal event name, which must be used when referencing the event from this event definitions API. If a name is not supplied, one will be generated based on the label. The `name` value will also be used to automatically generate a `fullyQualifiedName` for the event definition, which you'll use when sending event completions to this event.

description.description: A description of the event that will be shown as help text in HubSpot.

label.description: Human readable label for the event. Used in HubSpot UI

primaryObject.description: The object type to associate this event to. Can be one of CONTACT, COMPANY, DEAL, TICKET. If no primaryObject is supplied, we will default to associating the event to CONTACT objects.

propertyDefinitions.description: List of custom properties on event

name.description: Internal property name, which must be used when referencing the property from the API

options.description: A list of available options for the property if it is an enumeration. NOTE: This field is only applicable for enumerated properties.

description.description: A description of the property that will be shown as help text in HubSpot.

label.description: Human readable label for the property. Used in HubSpot UI

type.description: The data type of the property. Can be one of the following: [string, number, enumeration, datetime]

name.description: Internal event name, which must be used when referencing the event from this event definitions API. If a name is not supplied, one will be generated based on the label. The `name` value will also be used to automatically generate a `fullyQualifiedName` for the event definition, which you'll use when sending event completions to this event.

description.description: A description of the event that will be shown as help text in HubSpot.

label.description: Human readable label for the event. Used in HubSpot UI

primaryObject.description: The object type to associate this event to. Can be one of CONTACT, COMPANY, DEAL, TICKET. If no primaryObject is supplied, we will default to associating the event to CONTACT objects.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of a specific custom event definition.

arguments.description: The internal name of the custom event to fetch its definition.

api_endpoints.description: Fetch a single custom event definition by name.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of deletion of the custom event definition.

arguments.name: event_name
arguments.description: The name of the custom event definition to delete.

api_endpoints.description: Delete a custom event definition by name.

value_schema.description: The name of the event definition.

path.description: The name of the event definition.

description.detailed: Use this tool to update the definition of a specific custom event in Hubspot by specifying the event name.

arguments.name: internal_event_name
arguments.description: The internal name of the custom event to be updated in Hubspot.

arguments.name: event_property_details
arguments.description: JSON object containing the new event property's details, such as name, type, label, description, and options if applicable.

arguments.description: The internal name of the custom event to be updated. Required to identify which event's property is being modified.

arguments.name: property_update_details
arguments.description: JSON object containing updates for the property. Includes options for enumerated properties, description, and label.

api_endpoints.name: post-/events/v3/send/batch_send

description.tagline: Send multiple event completions in one request.
description.detailed: Use this tool to efficiently send multiple event completions to the Hubspot Events service in a single batch. Call this tool when you need to report multiple events at once to streamline processing and reduce network calls.

arguments.name: event_batch
arguments.description: A JSON array of event objects, each with details like `occurredAt`, `eventName`, `utk`, `uuid`, `email`, `properties`, and `objectId`, to send multiple event completions.

api_endpoints.summary: Send a batch of event completions
api_endpoints.description: Send multiple event completions at once.

occurredAt.description: The time when this event occurred. If this isn't set, the current time will be used.

eventName.description: The internal name of the event (`pe<portalID>_eventName`). Can be retrieved through the [event definitions API](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/reference/api/analytics-and-events/custom-events/custom-event-definitions#get-%2Fevents%2Fv3%2Fevent-definitions) or in [HubSpot's UI](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/reports/create-custom-behavioral-events-with-the-code-wizard#find-internal-name).

utk.description: The visitor's usertoken. Used for associating the event data with a CRM record.

uuid.description: Include a universally unique identifier to assign a unique ID to the event completion. Can be useful for matching data between HubSpot and other external systems.

email.description: The visitor's email address. Used for associating the event data with a CRM record.

properties.description: The event properties to update. Takes the format of key-value pairs (property internal name and property value). Learn more about [HubSpot's default event properties](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/analytics-and-events/custom-events/custom-event-definitions#hubspot-s-default-event-properties).

objectId.description: The ID of the object that completed the event (e.g., contact ID or visitor ID).

occurredAt.description: The time when this event occurred. If this isn't set, the current time will be used.

eventName.description: The internal name of the event (`pe<portalID>_eventName`). Can be retrieved through the [event definitions API](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/reference/api/analytics-and-events/custom-events/custom-event-definitions#get-%2Fevents%2Fv3%2Fevent-definitions) or in [HubSpot's UI](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/reports/create-custom-behavioral-events-with-the-code-wizard#find-internal-name).

utk.description: The visitor's usertoken. Used for associating the event data with a CRM record.

uuid.description: Include a universally unique identifier to assign a unique ID to the event completion. Can be useful for matching data between HubSpot and other external systems.

email.description: The visitor's email address. Used for associating the event data with a CRM record.

properties.description: The event properties to update. Takes the format of key-value pairs (property internal name and property value). Learn more about [HubSpot's default event properties](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/analytics-and-events/custom-events/custom-event-definitions#hubspot-s-default-event-properties).

objectId.description: The ID of the object that completed the event (e.g., contact ID or visitor ID).

api_endpoints.name: post-/events/v3/send_send

description.tagline: Send data for a single event completion.
description.detailed: This tool is used to send data related to the completion of a single event. It should be called when there is a need to log or submit event information to Hubspot's system.

arguments.name: event_data
arguments.description: JSON object containing event details including occurredAt, eventName, utk, uuid, email, properties, and objectId.

api_endpoints.description: Send data for a single event completion.

occurredAt.description: The time when this event occurred. If this isn't set, the current time will be used.

eventName.description: The internal name of the event (`pe<portalID>_eventName`). Can be retrieved through the [event definitions API](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/reference/api/analytics-and-events/custom-events/custom-event-definitions#get-%2Fevents%2Fv3%2Fevent-definitions) or in [HubSpot's UI](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/reports/create-custom-behavioral-events-with-the-code-wizard#find-internal-name).

email.description: The visitor's email address. Used for associating the event data with a CRM record.

Learn more about [HubSpot's default event properties](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/analytics-and-events/custom-events/custom-event-definitions#hubspot-s-default-event-properties).

objectId.description: The ID of the object that completed the event (e.g., contact ID or visitor ID).

occurredAt.description: The time when this event occurred. If this isn't set, the current time will be used.

eventName.description: The internal name of the event (`pe<portalID>_eventName`). Can be retrieved through the [event definitions API](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/reference/api/analytics-and-events/custom-events/custom-event-definitions#get-%2Fevents%2Fv3%2Fevent-definitions) or in [HubSpot's UI](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/reports/create-custom-behavioral-events-with-the-code-wizard#find-internal-name).

email.description: The visitor's email address. Used for associating the event data with a CRM record.

properties.description: The event properties to update. Takes the format of key-value pairs (property internal name and property value). Learn more about [HubSpot's default event properties](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/analytics-and-events/custom-events/custom-event-definitions#hubspot-s-default-event-properties).

scopes.behavioral_events.event_definitions.read: Read from and write to custom behavioral events definitions
